longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for the compensation and other benefits of persons who have been exposed to noise in their working environment and have suffered noise-induced deafness and for connected matters.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Occupational Deafness (Compensation) Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: amending Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Occupational Deafness (Compensation) (Amendment) Ordinance 1998 (5 of 1998); (Added 5 of 1998 s. 2)
applicant (申請人) means a person who makes an application for direct payment of expenses or reimbursement of expenses under section 27D; (Added 16 of 2003 s. 3. Amended 6 of 2010 s. 3)

binaural hearing loss (雙耳聽力損失) means sensorineural hearing loss amounting to not less than 40 dB in each ear, where such loss is due in the case of at least one ear to noise, and being the average of hearing losses measured by audiometry over the 1, 2 and 3 kHz frequencies; (Added 6 of 2010 s. 3)
continuous contract (連續性合約) has the same meaning as in section 3 of the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57);

def.name: DesignatedMedicalPractitioner
def.leadIn: designated medical practitioner (指定醫生) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a medical practitioner conferred by the Hong Kong Academy of Medicine with the designation of Fellow of the Hong Kong Academy of Medicine (Otorhinolaryngology); or

paragraph.name: b

section.def: device provider (器具提供者), in relation to an application made under section 27B(1A), means the person from whom the applicant has acquired, or intends to acquire, the hearing assistive device mentioned in that section or the service for fitting, repair or maintenance of the hearing assistive device; (Added 6 of 2010 s. 3)

direct payment of expenses (直接支付開支) means the payment by the Board of the expenses mentioned in section 27B(1A) directly to the device provider on an application made under that section; (Added 6 of 2010 s. 3)

def.name: Discotheque
def.leadIn: discotheque (的士高) means any premises used mainly for the purpose of carrying out an activity where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the main attribute of the activity is dancing by the persons participating in the activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recorded music characterized by a heavy rhythmic element is provided for the activity; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the control or operation of a system for playing back and broadcasting the music referred to in paragraph (b) by a disc jockey forms part of the activity; (Added 16 of 2003 s. 3)

section.def: Employees’ Compensation Insurance Levies Management Board (僱員補償保險徵款管理局) means the board established by section 3 of the Employees’ Compensation Insurance Levies Ordinance (Cap. 411);
financial year (財政年度) means the financial year of the Board fixed under section 8 of Schedule 1;
hearing assistive device (聽力輔助器具) means a device prescribed in Schedule 6 and any component or accessory of such device; (Added 16 of 2003 s. 3)
hearing test (聽力測驗) means a hearing test designated by the Board under section 36;
hearing test centre (聽力測驗中心) means a place designated by the Board as a hearing test centre under section 36;
Hong Kong Academy of Medicine (香港醫學專科學院) means the Hong Kong Academy of Medicine established by the Hong Kong Academy of Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 419);
Hospital Authority (醫管局) means the Hospital Authority established by the Hospital Authority Ordinance (Cap. 113);
Medical Committee (醫事委員會) means the Occupational Deafness Medical Committee appointed under section 12;
medical examination (醫療檢驗) means a medical examination designated by the Board under section 36;

monaural hearing loss (單耳聽力損失) means sensorineural hearing loss amounting to not less than 40 dB in only one ear, where such loss is due to noise, and being the average of hearing losses measured by audiometry over the 1, 2 and 3 kHz frequencies; (Added 6 of 2010 s. 3)

def.name: NoiseinducedDeafness
def.leadIn: noise-induced deafness (噪音所致的失聰) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: binaural hearing loss; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: monaural hearing loss; (Replaced 6 of 2010 s. 3)

section.def: noisy occupation (高噪音工作) means an occupation specified in Schedule 3;
reimbursement of expenses (付還開支) means the reimbursement of any expenses under Part VIIA; (Added 16 of 2003 s. 3)
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Labour and Welfare; (Replaced L.N. 106 of 2002. Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)
specified form (指明表格、指明格式) means such form as may be specified by the Board under section 38.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application to the Crown
section.content: This Ordinance binds the Crown.

subsection.content:
There is established a board known as the
“Occupational Deafness Compensation Board”. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)
The Board is a body corporate.
Schedule 1 has effect with respect to the Board.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Functions and powers of the Board

subsection.leadIn: The functions of the Board are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to hold the Fund upon trust and to manage and administer the Fund in accordance with this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to receive for the benefit of the Fund any sum paid to the Board pursuant to section 7 of the Employees’ Compensation Insurance Levies Ordinance (Cap. 411) and any sum paid to the Board under section 7(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to process and determine applications by persons applying for compensation, direct payment of expenses or reimbursement of expenses; (Amended 16 of 2003 s. 4; 6 of 2010 s. 4)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to advise the Employees’ Compensation Insurance Levies Management Board with respect to the amounts of known and anticipated claims against the Fund; (Amended 5 of 1998 s. 3)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: to conduct or finance educational and publicity programmes for the purpose of preventing noise-induced deafness by reason of employment; (Added 5 of 1998 s. 3. Amended 16 of 2003 s. 4)

paragraph.name: db
paragraph.content: to conduct or finance programmes for the rehabilitation of persons suffering, or who have suffered, from noise-induced deafness by reason of employment; and (Added 16 of 2003 s. 4. Amended 6 of 2010 s. 4)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: such other functions as are assigned to it under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hold, acquire, sell, lease or otherwise dispose of all kinds of property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter into, assign or accept the assignment of, and vary any contract or obligation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: meet expenditure on any item shown in the estimates of expenditure of the Board approved under section 8 of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: charge fees for the use of any facility or service provided by the Board; and (Amended 5 of 1998 s. 3)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: do such other things as are necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the better carrying out of its functions.

subsection.content: Except with the prior approval of the Financial Secretary, the Board shall not allow the aggregate sum borrowed or otherwise raised under subsection (2)(d) at any time to exceed 10% of the total estimated expenditure approved under section 8 of Schedule 1 for the current financial year.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Establishment of Occupational Deafness Compensation Fund

subsection.leadIn: There is established an Occupational Deafness Compensation Fund which consists of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: moneys received by the Board from the Employees’ Compensation Insurance Levies Management Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any moneys provided by the Government for the purposes of the Fund; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other moneys and property, including gifts, donations, interests and accumulation of income received by the Board.

subsection.content: The Fund is vested in the Board.
The Government shall each year make payments to the Board for the benefit of the Fund out of moneys appropriated for that purpose by the Legislative Council.
The Government’s payment under subsection (1) is ascertained as follows—
where—

“B” is the proportion of the net resources of the Employees’ Compensation Insurance Levies Management Board specified in the third column of Schedule 2 to the Employees’ Compensation Insurance Levies Ordinance (Cap. 411) to be distributed to the Occupational Deafness Compensation Board under section 7(1) of that Ordinance;
“C” is the number of employees in the civil service sector;
“D” is the total number of employees in Hong Kong, excluding the number of employees in the civil service sector.

section.name: s0
section.content: The number of employees in the civil service sector and the total number of employees in Hong Kong are those respective numbers estimated and published from time to time by the Commissioner for Census and Statistics.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Payments by the Board from the Fund
section.leadIn: The Board shall pay from the Fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: compensation;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: reimbursement of expenses; (Added 16 of 2003 s. 6)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any sum payable under section 27;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: costs of hearing tests and medical examinations arranged by the Board under section 16;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other expenses incurred by the Board in the performance of its functions or exercise of its powers under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other sums required or permitted to be paid by the Board under this Ordinance.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Investment of funds
section.leadIn: The Board may deal with the funds of the Board that are not immediately required in the following manner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by depositing them on fixed term or call deposit or in a savings account in any bank within the meaning of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to the prior approval of the Financial Secretary, by investing them in such investments as the Board thinks fit.

subsection.content: The Director of Audit may carry out such examination as he thinks fit into the economy, efficiency and effectiveness with which the Board has used its resources in performing its functions and exercising its powers.

The Director of Audit has a right of access at all reasonable times to all such documents in the custody or under the control of the Board as he may reasonably require for the purpose of carrying out any examination under subsection (1) and is entitled to require from any person holding or accountable for any such document such information and explanations (if any) as are reasonably necessary for that purpose.
The Director of Audit may submit to the President of the Legislative Council a report in respect of any examination carried out under subsection (1).
Subsection (1) does not give the Director of Audit the right to question the merits of any of the Board’s policy objectives.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Statements and reports to be laid on table of Legislative Council
section.leadIn: The Board shall, within 9 months after the end of each financial year or such longer period as the Chief Executive may determine, submit— (Amended 16 of 2003 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a report on the activities and affairs of the Board for that year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the statements of the accounts therefor; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the auditor’s report on the accounts prepared under section 12(3) of Schedule 1,

section.continued: to the Chief Executive who shall cause them to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council.

subsection.content:
The Secretary shall appoint a committee to be known as the
“Occupational Deafness Medical Committee”. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)
Schedule 2 has effect with respect to the Medical Committee.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Functions of Medical Committee
section.leadIn: The functions of the Medical Committee are—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: to recommend to the Board audiological facilities and calibration methods to be used in such hearing tests and medical examinations;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to recommend to the Board places where hearing tests under section 15(2) can be performed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to advise the Board under section 19 or 27E(3)(b)(i); (Amended 5 of 1998 s. 5; 16 of 2003 s. 9)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: to recommend to the Board categories of persons that may be designated under section 36(1)(e); and (Added 16 of 2003 s. 9)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to advise the Board generally on the medical, technical and professional aspects of any matter relating to the performance of the Board’s functions.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Entitlement to and Applications for Compensation

section.name: s14
section.heading: Entitlement to compensation for the first time

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3) and (4) and sections 17 and 29, a person who suffers noise-induced deafness is entitled to such compensation as determined by the Board under this Ordinance if he also satisfies the Board that he fulfils the conditions specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The conditions referred to in subsection (1) are—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that he has had at least 10 years of employment in aggregate in any noisy occupation in Hong Kong before the date of the relevant application under section 15; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that he has had at least 5 years of employment in aggregate in any noisy occupation specified in paragraphs (c), (j), (k) and (y) of Schedule 3 in Hong Kong before the date of the relevant application under section 15; (Replaced 5 of 1998 s. 6)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (4), that he has at any time been employed under a continuous contract in any noisy occupation in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: within the 12 months before the date of his relevant application under section 15; (Amended 5 of 1998 s. 6)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: he has not been awarded any compensation; and (Amended 5 of 1998 s. 6)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if he has previously made an application for compensation for which the entitlement arose under this section (previous application)— (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 5)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which has been refused under section 22(1)(a) on or after 6 March 1998; and (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 5)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in respect of which the Board has not been requested to review its decision under section 23(1) or the Board has confirmed its decision under section 23(2),

paragraph.continued: he has had at least 24 months of employment in aggregate in any noisy occupation in Hong Kong after the date of that previous application or, where he has made more than one such previous application, after the date of the last such application. (Added 5 of 1998 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: No compensation is payable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a member of the Chinese People’s Liberation Army; (Amended 2 of 2012 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: to a person in the service of or formerly in the service of the Government who, in consequence of incapacity resulting from noise-induced deafness which arose in the course of his employment, is paid a pension or gratuity under any Ordinance which would not be payable if such deafness arose otherwise than in the course of his employment.

subsection.content: No compensation is payable to a person who fulfils the condition specified in subsection (2)(b)(i) but not the condition specified in subsection (2)(b)(ii) unless his application for compensation is made not later than 30 June 1997. (Amended 69 of 1996 s. 2)

section.name: s14A
section.heading: Entitlement to further compensation for additional permanent incapacity resulting from noise-induced deafness

subsection.content: Subject to sections 14(3), 17 and 29, after a person has been awarded compensation on an application under section 15, the person is entitled to further compensation for any additional permanent incapacity resulting from noise-induced deafness suffered if the Board is satisfied that the person fulfils the conditions specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The conditions referred to in subsection (1) are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person has had at least 3 years of employment in aggregate in any noisy occupation in Hong Kong after—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of the person’s last successful application for compensation under section 15 (the latest successful application);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the latest successful application was made for compensation for which the entitlement arose under section 48(3), the date of the previous unsuccessful application mentioned in section 48(3)(b) or, where there was more than one such previous unsuccessful application, the date of the last such application; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the latest successful application was made for compensation for which the entitlement arose under section 48(5), the date of the self-arranged audiometric test mentioned in section 48(5)(a) or, where there was more than one such test, the date of the last such test;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person has at any time been employed under a continuous contract in any noisy occupation in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: within the 12 months before the person makes an application for compensation based on an entitlement arising under this section; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (3), within the 12 months before the date of the latest successful application; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the person has previously made an application for compensation for which the entitlement arose under this section and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Board refused the application under section 22(1)(ab); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Board has not been requested to review the decision under section 23(1) or the Board has confirmed the decision under section 23(2),

paragraph.continued: the person has had at least 24 months of employment in aggregate in any noisy occupation in Hong Kong after the date of the previous application or, if the person has made more than one such previous application in respect of which the facts mentioned in subparagraphs (i) and (ii) apply, after the date of the last such application.

subsection.leadIn: The condition specified in subsection (2)(b)(ii) applies only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the latest successful application was made for compensation for which the entitlement arose under section 48(3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person cannot fulfil the condition specified in subsection (2)(b)(i); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the application for compensation based on an entitlement arising under this section is made within a period of 12 months beginning on the date when compensation was paid in respect of the latest successful application.

subsection.content: A person who wishes to apply for compensation must apply to the Board in the specified form and must submit, together with the application, such information as will satisfy the Board that he or she fulfils the conditions specified in section 14(2), 14A(2) or 48(1)(i), (3) or (5). (Replaced 6 of 2010 s. 7)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A person who wishes to apply for compensation based on an entitlement arising under section 14A must also submit a certificate of determination of compensation under section 24(1) or (3), or a copy of a court order made under section 28(4), in relation to the latest successful application mentioned in section 14A(2)(a). (Added 6 of 2010 s. 7)

Subject to section 48(4) and (9), upon confirmation by the Board that a claimant fulfils the conditions specified in section 14(2), 14A(2) or 48(1)(i), the claimant must undergo a hearing test at a hearing test centre or a medical examination, or both, arranged by the Board under section 16(1). (Replaced 6 of 2010 s. 7)

part.name: P6
part.heading: Assessment of Noise-induced Deafness and Determination of Permanent Incapacity

section.name: s16
section.heading: Hearing tests, medical examinations and inquiries

subsection.leadIn: The Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require a claimant to undergo such hearing tests and medical examinations arranged by the Board as it considers necessary; and (Amended 5 of 1998 s. 8)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make such investigations and inquiries into any other matter concerning a claimant’s deafness or his occupational history as it considers necessary.

subsection.content: Where a claimant undergoes a hearing test or medical examination as arranged by the Board under subsection (1), the person who performs the test or examination shall, as soon as practicable, issue to the Board a report in the specified form. (Amended 5 of 1998 s. 8)
The Board may delegate its powers to make investigations and inquiries to such persons as it thinks fit.

A person from whom information relevant to an application for compensation is requested by the Board or its delegates under subsection (3) in exercise of its power under subsection (1) shall provide such information which is in his possession or under his control to the Board or its delegates.
Any person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Duty of claimants and failure by claimants

subsection.content: Every claimant shall assist the Board or its delegates in making investigations or inquiries under section 16 and shall undergo all hearing tests and medical examinations arranged by the Board under that section.
Where a claimant, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (1), the Board may determine that the claimant is not entitled to compensation.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Diagnosis and assessment of noise-induced deafness

subsection.leadIn: Where a claimant undergoes a medical examination by a designated medical practitioner arranged under section 16, the designated medical practitioner shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: diagnose whether the claimant is suffering from noise-induced deafness; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where noise-induced deafness is diagnosed) assess the noise-induced deafness suffered by the claimant,

subsection.continued: and shall include the diagnosis, and assessment if any, in the report under section 16(2).

subsection.leadIn: Where the designated medical practitioner performing a medical examination arranged under section 16 is uncertain of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cause of the claimant’s deafness; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the degree of the claimant’s noise-induced deafness,

subsection.continued: he shall report the matter in the report under section 16(2).

section.name: s19
section.heading: Referral to Medical Committee
section.content: The Board may refer a report referred to in section 16(2) or 48(5)(a) to the Medical Committee for such advice as may be conducive to the Board’s determination on the relevant application for compensation.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Determination of noise-induced deafness, permanent incapacity and additional permanent incapacity

subsection.content: Subject to section 48(4) and (9), the Board must determine the noise-induced deafness suffered by the claimant having regard to the diagnoses and assessments in the report or reports referred to in section 16(2) and the advice of the Medical Committee, where appropriate.

In relation to a claimant suffering from binaural hearing loss, the Board must, on the basis of the noise-induced deafness of the claimant determined under subsection (1), determine, in accordance with Schedule 4, the percentage of permanent incapacity of the claimant which is to be the percentage correlating to the average hearing loss for both the better ear and the worse ear of the claimant.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: In relation to a claimant suffering from monaural hearing loss, the Board must, on the basis of the noise-induced deafness of the claimant determined under subsection (1) or section 48(4) or (9), determine the percentage of permanent incapacity of the claimant which is to be the percentage set out in subsection (2B). (Added 6 of 2010 s. 9)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: The percentage mentioned in subsection (2A) is half of the percentage shown in Schedule 4 that correlates to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the average hearing loss for the worse ear of the claimant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the average hearing loss shown in the first column for the better ear as shown in Schedule 4. (Added 6 of 2010 s. 9)

subsection.name: 2C
subsection.text: In relation to a claimant applying for compensation based on an entitlement arising under section 14A, the Board must determine the percentage of additional permanent incapacity of the claimant which is to be calculated as follows—
subsection.leadIn: where—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: “B” means the percentage of permanent incapacity stated in the certificate of determination of compensation or the court order in relation to the latest successful application mentioned in section 14A(2)(a). (Added 6 of 2010 s. 9)

subsection.name: 2D
subsection.content: If the percentage of additional permanent incapacity is smaller than zero, the percentage is to be taken to be zero. (Added 6 of 2010 s. 9)

Subject to section 48(2)(c), the Board must make a determination under subsection (1), (2) or (2A) or section 48(4) or (9) in accordance with this Ordinance as in force on the date of that determination, irrespective of the date of the application under section 15 to which the determination relates. (Added 5 of 1998 s. 10)

section.name: s21
section.heading: Determination of compensation for permanent incapacity and additional permanent incapacity
section.content: The Board must determine the amount of compensation payable to a claimant for permanent incapacity or additional permanent incapacity in accordance with Schedule 5 as in force on the date of the determination of the amount, irrespective of the date of the application under section 15 to which the determination relates.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determines that the claimant does not suffer from noise-induced deafness; (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 11)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: determines under section 20 that the percentage of additional permanent incapacity suffered by the claimant is zero; or (Added 6 of 2010 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise determines that the claimant is not entitled to compensation,

subsection.continued: the Board shall refuse his application for compensation and shall send a notice of refusal informing the claimant of such refusal and reasons for the refusal.

subsection.content: Where a claimant has undergone a hearing test or medical examination under section 16(1) in respect of his application for compensation, a notice of refusal referred to in subsection (1) shall be accompanied by a copy of the report issued to the Board in accordance with section 16(2).

section.name: s23
section.heading: Review of refusal by the Board

subsection.content: A claimant receiving a notice of refusal from the Board under section 22 may, within 14 days beginning on the date of the notice, request the Board to review its decision by sending to the Board a request in writing stating his reasons.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Board may, if it thinks fit, extend the time within which a claimant may request the Board to review its decision under this section. (Added 5 of 1998 s. 12)

Upon receipt of a request under subsection (1), the Board shall review its decision and may confirm, vary or reverse the decision, and shall inform the claimant of the result of the review in writing.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Certificate of determination of compensation, objection and review

subsection.leadIn: Where the Board has determined under section 21 that a claimant is entitled to compensation and the amount payable, the Board shall issue a certificate in the specified form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating the particulars of the claimant’s noise-induced deafness, his percentage of permanent incapacity or additional permanent incapacity, and the amount of compensation payable to him, as determined by the Board; and (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 12)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: asking the claimant to indicate in the specified form whether he objects to the amount of compensation payable.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A certificate issued under subsection (1) shall be accompanied by a copy of the report issued to the Board in accordance with section 16(2). (Added 5 of 1998 s. 13)

A claimant may object to the amount of compensation stated in the certificate issued to him under subsection (1) within 14 days beginning on the date of the certificate by indicating to the Board in the specified form that he objects to the amount and stating the grounds of his objection.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Board may, if it thinks fit, extend the time within which a claimant may object to the amount of compensation under this section. (Added 5 of 1998 s. 13)

subsection.leadIn: On receipt of an objection under subsection (2), the Board shall review its determination and shall issue a certificate in the specified form stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the original determination is confirmed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the revised amount of compensation determined and the particulars of the revised determination.

subsection.content: Where a claimant has received compensation from the Board, he loses his right to object under subsection (2).

Subject to section 30A, where the claimant indicates in writing that he does not object to the amount of the compensation, the Board shall pay to the claimant compensation as stated in the certificate issued under section 24(1) within 21 days beginning on the date of the receipt of the indication. (Amended 16 of 2003 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 30A, where the Board has conducted a review under section 24(3), the Board shall, within 21 days beginning on the date of the certificate issued under section 24(3), pay to the claimant compensation as stated in the certificate— (Amended 16 of 2003 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under section 24(1), where the original determination is confirmed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under section 24(3), where the original determination is revised.

subsection.content: Compensation that remains unpaid at the expiry of the period prescribed in subsection (1) or (2) shall carry simple interest as from the date of such expiry until such time as it is paid, calculated at the rate determined from time to time by the Chief Justice for the purposes of section 49(1)(b) of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4). (Replaced 16 of 2003 s. 11)

section.name: s26
section.heading: Death of claimant
section.content: Where a certificate stating that an amount of compensation is payable to a claimant has been issued under section 24(1) or (3) and the claimant dies before the compensation is paid to him, the Board shall pay the compensation to the estate of the deceased claimant.

section.name: s27
section.heading: The Board to pay compensation to the Government in certain circumstances
section.leadIn: Where the Board is satisfied by the Government that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Government has paid a pension or gratuity to a person in respect of his permanent incapacity resulting from noise-induced deafness under any Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: had the person not been paid such pension or gratuity, he would have been entitled to compensation,

section.continued: the Board shall pay to the Government from the Fund a sum equal to the amount of compensation that would have been payable to that person in respect of that permanent incapacity.

section.name: s27A
section.heading: Determination of application upon withdrawal

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a claimant indicates in writing or otherwise to the Board that he does not wish to proceed with his application for compensation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he has undergone a hearing test or medical examination under section 16(1) in respect of that application,

section.continued: the Board may, if it thinks fit, continue to process or determine the application as if the claimant had not made such indication.

part.name: P7A
part.heading: Direct Payment of Expenses or Reimbursement of Expenses in relation to Hearing Assistive Devices

section.name: s27B
section.heading: Direct payment of expenses or reimbursement of expenses in relation to hearing assistive devices

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has at any time been entitled to compensation pursuant to a determination made under section 21;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: has at any time been entitled to compensation pursuant to a decision made under section 23; (Added 6 of 2010 s. 14)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has at any time been entitled to compensation pursuant to a court order made under section 28; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has at any time been paid by the Government a pension or gratuity under any Ordinance in consequence of incapacity resulting from noise-induced deafness which arose in the course of his or her employment,

subsection.continued: may on application to the Board be reimbursed by the Board for any expenses he or she has reasonably incurred in the acquisition, fitting, repair or maintenance of a hearing assistive device used by him or her in connection with his or her ear that suffers, or has suffered, from noise-induced deafness.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A person who fulfils the conditions specified in subsection (1)(a), (aa), (b) or (c) may apply to the Board for payment by the Board directly to the device provider of any expenses he or she may reasonably incur in the acquisition, fitting, repair or maintenance of a hearing assistive device used or to be used by him or her in connection with his or her ear that suffers, or has suffered, from noise-induced deafness. (Added 6 of 2010 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: The following expenses are not reimbursable under subsection (1) or payable under subsection (1A)— (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: expenses incurred before the date on which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a certificate was issued to the person under section 24(1);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the court order referred to in subsection (1)(b) was made; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any pension or gratuity referred to in subsection (1)(c) was first paid to him or her; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expenses met by any grant, sponsorship or donation given to him or her by any person for the purpose of the acquisition, fitting, repair or maintenance of a hearing assistive device.

subsection.content: Expenses in respect of a hearing assistive device that is a hearing aid must not be reimbursed under subsection (1) or paid under subsection (1A) unless advice in writing indicating that the applicant reasonably requires the use of the hearing aid has been given by a person belonging to a category of persons designated under section 36(1)(e).

section.name: s27C
section.heading: Limits of direct payment of expenses and reimbursement of expenses

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person applies for reimbursement of expenses or direct payment of expenses for the purpose of the acquisition and fitting of a hearing assistive device; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application is the person’s first application for that purpose under this Part,

subsection.continued: the amount of expenses that may be reimbursed to the applicant or paid directly to the device provider for the applicant as determined under section 27E must not exceed the amount prescribed for the purposes of this subsection in Schedule 7, as in force on the date of that determination.

subsection.leadIn: The aggregate of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any amount of expenses reimbursed to an applicant as determined under section 27E; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any amount of expenses paid directly to the device provider for the applicant as determined under that section,

subsection.continued: must not exceed the amount prescribed for the purposes of this subsection in Schedule 7, as in force on the date of the determination by the Board in respect of the applicant under that section, irrespective of the number of applications under section 15 that the applicant has made.

section.name: s27D
section.heading: Application for direct payment of expenses or reimbursement of expenses

subsection.content: An application for reimbursement of expenses based on an entitlement arising under section 27B(1) must be in a specified form and must be made within a period of 12 months beginning on the date on which the expenses were incurred. (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 16)

subsection.leadIn: An application made under subsection (1) must be accompanied by— (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 16)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the original receipt issued in respect of the expenses to which the application relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the expenses relate to a hearing aid, the advice referred to in section 27B(3), unless the advice has already been sent to the Board.

subsection.leadIn: An application for direct payment of expenses under section 27B(1A) must be in a specified form and accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such documents relating to the expenses as may be reasonably required by the Board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the expenses relate to a hearing aid, the advice referred to in section 27B(3), unless the advice has already been sent to the Board. (Added 6 of 2010 s. 16)

subsection.leadIn: The Board shall consider any application made under section 27D, and shall determine in accordance with sections 27B, 27C and 27D—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the application relates to reimbursement of expenses—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whether the applicant is entitled to reimbursement of any expenses; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the applicant is so entitled, the amount of that reimbursement; or (Replaced 6 of 2010 s. 17)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the application relates to direct payment of expenses—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whether the applicant is entitled to have any expenses paid by the Board directly to the device provider; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the applicant is so entitled, the amount of those expenses. (Replaced 6 of 2010 s. 17)

subsection.content: The Board shall by notice in writing inform an applicant of its determination under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of making a determination under subsection (1), the Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require an applicant to undergo such test or examination as it considers necessary, at the cost of the Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: refer any information relevant to an application to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Medical Committee;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a designated medical practitioner; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a person belonging to a category of persons designated under section 36(1)(e),

paragraph.continued: for advice as to whether the use by the applicant of the relevant hearing assistive device or the repair or maintenance of such device is or was reasonably required.

subsection.content: Where an applicant fails without reasonable excuse to undergo a test or examination required under subsection (3)(a), the Board may determine that he is not entitled to any reimbursement of expenses or to have any expenses paid by the Board directly to the device provider. (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 17)
An applicant in respect of whom a determination has been made under section 27E(1) may request the Board to review the determination.

subsection.leadIn: A request under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be sent to the Board within a period of 14 days beginning on the date of the notice issued to him under section 27E(2); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the reasons for requesting the review.

subsection.content: The Board may, if it thinks fit, extend the time limit mentioned in subsection (2)(b).
Upon receipt of a request under subsection (1), the Board shall review its determination and may, after the review, confirm, vary or reverse the determination.
The Board shall by notice in writing inform the applicant of the result of its review.

subsection.leadIn: No request for review shall be made under subsection (1) in respect of any amount of expenses that— (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have been reimbursed to, and received by, the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have been determined by the Board to be paid for the applicant directly to the device provider, if any of the events mentioned in subsection (7) happens. (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 18)

subsection.leadIn: The events referred to in subsection (6)(b) are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the hearing assistive device is to be acquired by the applicant from the device provider, the hearing assistive device has been acquired by the applicant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the hearing assistive device is to be fitted, repaired or maintained by the device provider, the hearing assistive device so fitted, repaired or maintained has been returned to the applicant. (Added 6 of 2010 s. 18)

section.name: s27G
section.heading: Direct payment of expenses and reimbursement of expenses

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 30A, if an applicant is entitled to any amount pursuant to a determination made under section 27E(1)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii), the Board must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the application relates to direct payment of expenses, pay the amount directly to the device provider as soon as reasonably practicable after the date mentioned in subsection (3A) or the expiry of a period of 14 days beginning on the date of the notice mentioned in paragraph (a), whichever is the later. (Replaced 6 of 2010 s. 19)

subsection.content: Where a request has been made for the review of a determination of the Board under section 27F(1), subsection (1) does not apply in respect of any amount payable under the determination. (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 19)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 30A—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any amount payable to an applicant at the conclusion of a review must be paid within a period of 21 days beginning on the date of the notice issued to the applicant under section 27F(5); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any amount that the Board must, at the conclusion of a review, pay for the applicant directly to the device provider must be paid as soon as reasonably practicable after the date of the notice issued to the applicant under section 27F(5) or the date mentioned in subsection (3A), whichever is the later. (Replaced 6 of 2010 s. 19)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: The date referred to in subsections (1)(b) and (3)(b) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the hearing assistive device is to be acquired by the applicant from the device provider, the date when the device provider satisfies the Board that the hearing assistive device has been acquired by the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the hearing assistive device is to be fitted, repaired or maintained by the device provider, the date when the device provider satisfies the Board that the hearing assistive device so fitted, repaired or maintained has been returned to the applicant. (Added 6 of 2010 s. 19)

subsection.content: Any amount of reimbursement of expenses that remains unpaid at the expiry of the period prescribed in subsection (1) or (3) is to carry simple interest as from the date of such expiry until such time as it is paid, calculated at the rate determined from time to time by the Chief Justice for the purposes of section 49(1)(b) of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4). (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 19)

section.name: s27H
section.heading: Death of applicant
section.content: Where an applicant to whom any amount is payable pursuant to a notice issued under section 27E(2) or 27F(5) dies before the amount is paid to him, that amount shall be payable to his estate.

subsection.leadIn: A claimant who is dissatisfied with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the result of a review by the Board under section 23; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of compensation awarded to him as determined by the Board after a review under section 24(3),

subsection.continued: may appeal to the District Court.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: An applicant who is dissatisfied with the result of a review conducted under section 27F(4) may appeal to the District Court. (Added 16 of 2003 s. 13)

The time for making an appeal under this section is 6 months from the date of the written result of review issued under section 23(2), or of the certificate issued under section 24(3) or of the notice issued under section 27F(5) (as the case may be). (Amended 16 of 2003 s. 13)
The District Court may, if it thinks fit, extend the time within which an appeal may be made under this section.

On an appeal under this section, the District Court may confirm, vary or reverse any decision or determination of the Board and may make any further order, including any order as to costs, as it thinks fit.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Damages under common law and other enactments

subsection.content: Nothing in this Ordinance diminishes or extinguishes any right to damages or other compensation at common law or under any other enactment for permanent incapacity resulting from deafness.

Subject to subsection (3), where any person is awarded any damages or other compensation at common law or under any other enactment by a court in Hong Kong in respect of permanent incapacity resulting from sensorineural deafness suffered by him as a result of his exposure to noise in his working environment, the whole of the person’s entitlement to compensation or other payment under this Ordinance, if any, other than compensation or other payment payable prior to the date of such judgment, is extinguished.

Where a person’s entitlement to compensation or other payment under this Ordinance has been extinguished under subsection (2), his entitlement is revived if he satisfies the Board that he has tried all practicable means to obtain payment of the damages or other compensation awarded but has failed to obtain payment in full.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who in connection with an application for compensation, direct payment of expenses or reimbursement of expenses by himself or any other person provides any document or makes any statement or certification of facts which is false in a material particular and which— (Amended 16 of 2003 s. 14; 6 of 2010 s. 20)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he knows to be false in such particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he has no reasonable ground to believe to be true in such particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to imprisonment for 1 year and a fine at level 5.

subsection.content: Where a member of a professional body is alleged to have committed an offence under subsection (1), the Board may refer the allegation to that professional body.

If in the opinion of the Board, the available funds of the Fund are insufficient to pay all amounts of compensation, direct payment of expenses and reimbursement of expenses within the periods prescribed for their payment, the Board shall apply the available funds in payment of the compensation, direct payment of expenses and reimbursement of expenses in order of priority of the dates of the certificates or notices issued under section 24(1), 24(3), 27E(2) or 27F(5) (as the case may be).

Where the dates of any 2 or more certificates or notices referred to in subsection (1) are the same, the order of priority of payment for the purposes of that subsection is to be determined by reference to the dates of birth of the relevant claimants or applicants, with the amount payable in relation to the claimant or applicant who was born earlier being paid first.

Where the Board has come to the opinion described in subsection (1), it shall attach to any certificate or notice referred to in that subsection a statement indicating that the amount of the compensation, direct payment of expenses or reimbursement of expenses to which the certificate or notice relates is payable in the manner described in subsections (1) and (2).

section.name: s32
section.heading: Compensation, direct payment of expenses or reimbursement of expenses not to be assigned, charged or attached
section.content: Except under section 18A of the Legal Aid Ordinance (Cap. 91), compensation, direct payment of expenses or reimbursement of expenses is not capable of being assigned, charged or attached and does not pass to any other person by operation of law and no claim is to be set off against such compensation, direct payment of expenses or reimbursement of expenses.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Financial Secretary may charge fees
section.content: The Financial Secretary may charge the Board fees for any service provided to the Board or the Medical Committee by the Government.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Protection of members, etc. of Board and Medical Committee

subsection.leadIn: No—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: member of the Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: member of the Medical Committee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: member of any committee of the Board;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: employee of the Board,

subsection.continued: acting in good faith is personally liable for any act done or default made by—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the Board;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the Medical Committee;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: any committee of the Board,

subsection.continued: in the performance or purported performance of any function of the Board, the Medical Committee or such committee, as may be appropriate, under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The protection afforded under subsection (1) to any member or employee in respect of any act or default does not affect any liability of the Board for the act or default.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Evidence by certificate
section.content: A certificate purporting to be signed by the Chairman of the Board or any member of the Board authorized by the Board in that behalf stating that an amount of money has been paid from the Fund to the person named in the certificate on the date specified in the certificate is evidence of the fact in any proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: The Board may, on the recommendation of the Medical Committee, from time to time designate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the medical examinations to be performed by designated medical practitioners for the diagnosis and assessment of noise-induced deafness;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the hearing tests to be performed for the assessment of hearing loss and different classes or descriptions of hearing tests may be so designated to be performed by different categories of persons;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the audiological facilities and calibration methods to be used in hearing tests and medical examinations;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: places as hearing test centres where hearing tests under section 15(2) may be performed; (Amended 16 of 2003 s. 17)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the categories of persons who may give an advice under section 27B(3) or 27E(3)(b)(iii). (Added 16 of 2003 s. 17)

subsection.content: The Board may, by notice in the Gazette or any other means, promulgate any designation made under subsection (1).

section.name: s37
section.heading: Regulations by Chief Executive in Council
section.content: The Chief Executive in Council may by regulation provide for any matter generally for the better carrying out of the provisions and purposes of this Ordinance.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Forms
section.content: The Board may specify the form of any application, report, certificate or notice for the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice in the Gazette, amend Schedules 1, 2 and 3.
The Legislative Council may, by resolution, amend Schedules 4, 5 and 7.
The Secretary may, by notice in the Gazette, amend Schedule 6. (Added 16 of 2003 s. 19)

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 14(1), a person who— (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 23)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: suffers noise-induced deafness; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to satisfy the Board that he or she has at any time been employed under a continuous contract in any noisy occupation in Hong Kong within the 12 months before the date of his or her relevant application under section 15,

subsection.continued: is, subject to sections 14(3), 17 and 29, entitled to such compensation as determined by the Board under this Ordinance— (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 23)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: on satisfying the Board that he or she— (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 23)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: fulfils the conditions specified in section 14(2)(a), (c) and (d); and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: has been employed at any time beginning on 1 July 1989 under a continuous contract in any noisy occupation in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: if the application is made within 12 months beginning on the commencement of sections 1 to 20 of the amending Ordinance, that is to say, 6 March 1998. (Replaced 6 of 2010 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: Where, before the commencement of sections 1 to 20 of the amending Ordinance, that is to say, 6 March 1998— (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 23)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a claimant has incurred expenses under section 15(2) or (3) of the pre-amended 1998 Ordinance, then sections 8(c), 15(4) to (6) and 31 of the pre-amended 1998 Ordinance continues to apply to or in relation to such claimant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a report prepared under section 15(2) or (3) of the pre-amended 1998 Ordinance has been provided to the Board, then sections 16(1), 19 and 20(1) of the pre-amended 1998 Ordinance continues to apply to or in relation to such report;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a claimant has applied for compensation under section 15 of the pre-amended 1998 Ordinance and the Board has not determined the percentage of permanent incapacity of the claimant under section 20, the Board must make such determination in accordance with Schedule 4 to the pre-amended 1998 Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 14(1) and subject to sections 14(3) and 29, a person is entitled to such compensation as is determined by the Board under this Ordinance if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has not been awarded any compensation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has made a previous application for compensation under the pre-amended 2010 Ordinance that was refused under section 22(1)(a) of that Ordinance on the ground that he or she suffered from sensorineural hearing loss of not less than 40 dB in only one ear (previous unsuccessful application); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there is no evidence proving that the sensorineural hearing loss was not due to noise. (Replaced 6 of 2010 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a claimant applying for compensation based on an entitlement arising under subsection (3), the Board must determine the noise-induced deafness of the claimant having regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the result of the hearing test or medical examination as stated in the notice sent under section 22 in respect of the claimant’s previous unsuccessful application mentioned in subsection (3)(b) or, where there was more than one such previous unsuccessful application, the last such application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any advice of the Medical Committee given in respect of the deafness of the claimant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the result of any medical examination that the Board may have required the claimant to undergo under section 16(1); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any investigations and inquiries into any other matter concerning the claimant’s deafness or the claimant’s occupational history that the Board may have made under section 16(1). (Added 6 of 2010 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 14(1) and subject to sections 14(3) and 29, a person who has at any time suffered noise-induced deafness is entitled to such compensation as is determined by the Board under this Ordinance if—

paragraph.name: a

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at least 10 years of employment in aggregate in any noisy occupation in Hong Kong before the date of the self-arranged audiometric test; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the person has not been awarded any compensation; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: there is no evidence proving that the sensorineural hearing loss was not due to noise. (Added 6 of 2010 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: The requirements referred to in subsection (5)(a) are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the report must show the date on which the self-arranged audiometric test was conducted;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the report must show that the person suffered from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: hearing loss amounting to not less than 40 dB in only one ear, being the average of hearing losses measured by audiometry over the 1, 2 and 3 kHz frequencies; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the self-arranged audiometric test was conducted in Hong Kong within the period from 1 July 1995 to the date immediately before the date on which the 2010 Amendment Ordinance is published in the Gazette#;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if the person has undergone one or more hearing tests arranged by the Board in connection with the person’s application for compensation that was refused under section 22(1)(a) or, where there was more than one such application, the last such application, the self-arranged audiometric test was conducted after—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of the hearing test on the result of which the Board’s decision to refuse the application (first decision) was based;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the person has, under section 23, requested the Board to review the first decision, the date of the hearing test on the result of which the Board’s decision to refuse to vary or reverse the first decision (second decision) was based;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the person has, under section 28, appealed to the District Court against the second decision, the date of the hearing test on the result of which the District Court’s decision to refuse to vary or reverse the second decision was based; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the self-arranged audiometric test was conducted, or the result of the test was certified by a person belonging to a category of persons designated under section 36(1)(b). (Added 6 of 2010 s. 23)

subsection.content: If it is not reasonably practicable to ascertain the date of the hearing test mentioned in subparagraph (i), (ii) or (iii) of subsection (6)(e), that subparagraph is to be construed as if the reference to that date were a reference to the date of the Board’s decision or the District Court’s decision mentioned in that subparagraph. (Added 6 of 2010 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: If the hearing losses as shown in the self-arranged audiometric test mentioned in subsection (5)(a) were not measured by audiometry over the 1, 2 and 3 kHz frequencies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the report of the self-arranged audiometric test must contain information that makes it possible for the Medical Committee to infer the average hearing loss of the person over the 1, 2 and 3 kHz frequencies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Medical Committee may, if it considers it appropriate, infer the average hearing loss of the person over the 1, 2 and 3 kHz frequencies relying on the information given in the report. (Added 6 of 2010 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a claimant applying for compensation based on an entitlement arising under subsection (5), the Board must determine the noise-induced deafness of the claimant having regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the report mentioned in subsection (5)(a) or, where there was more than one such report, the last such report;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any advice of the Medical Committee given in respect of the deafness of the claimant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the result of any medical examination that the Board may have required the claimant to undergo under section 16(1); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any investigations and inquiries into any other matter concerning the claimant’s deafness or the claimant’s occupational history that the Board may have made under section 16(1). (Added 6 of 2010 s. 23)

subsection.content: Subsection (5) does not apply to a person who is entitled to apply for compensation for which the entitlement arises under subsection (3) or section 14. (Added 6 of 2010 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: A person who has applied for compensation for which the entitlement arose under section 14 (existing application) must not apply for compensation for which the entitlement arises under subsection (3) or (5) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the existing application is still pending;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the existing application has been refused by the Board under section 22 but there is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a pending review by the Board under section 23 in respect of the existing application; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a pending appeal to the District Court under section 28 concerning the Board’s review under section 23 in respect of the existing application. (Added 6 of 2010 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: If a person’s existing application has been refused by the Board under section 22, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person makes an application for compensation for which the entitlement arises under subsection (3) or (5) (section 48 application); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: before the section 48 application is disposed of, the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: requests a review by the Board under section 23 in respect of the existing application; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: appeals to the District Court under section 28 concerning the Board’s review under section 23 in respect of the existing application,

subsection.continued: then, the Board must not process the section 48 application until the review or appeal is disposed of. (Added 6 of 2010 s. 23)

subsection.content: If before the commencement* of the 2010 Amendment Ordinance, a claimant had applied for compensation under the pre-amended 2010 Ordinance but the Board had not at that commencement determined the noise-induced deafness of the claimant under section 20 of the pre-amended 2010 Ordinance, then, on or after that commencement, the Board must make the determination under this Ordinance. (Added 6 of 2010 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: pre-amended 1998 Ordinance (《修訂前的1998年條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement of sections 1 to 20 of the amending Ordinance, that is to say, 6 March 1998;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: pre-amended 2010 Ordinance (《修訂前的2010年條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement of the 2010 Amendment Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.def: 2010 Amendment Ordinance (《2010年修訂條例》) means the Occupational Deafness (Compensation) (Amendment) Ordinance 2010 (6 of 2010). (Added 6 of 2010 s. 23)

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Provisions with respect to the Board and Members thereof

section.name: s1
section.heading: Common seal
section.content: The Board has a common seal.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Board not servant or agent of Government
section.content: The Board is not to be regarded as a servant or agent of the Government or as enjoying any status, immunity or privilege of the Government.

subsection.leadIn: The Board consists of the following members all of whom are appointed by the Chief Executive— (Amended 16 of 2003 s. 20)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a chairman;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not more than 2 persons, not being public officers, who, in the opinion of the Chief Executive, represent employers;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not more than 2 persons, not being public officers, who, in the opinion of the Chief Executive, represent employees;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a medical practitioner;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an officer of the Hospital Authority who is a medical practitioner; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: not more than 2 public officers.

subsection.content: The appointment of a person appointed to the Board under subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) must not exceed 3 years.
A person appointed to the Board under subsection (1)(f) holds office at the pleasure of the Chief Executive.
Subject to subsection (3), a member of the Board holds and vacates his office in accordance with the terms of his appointment and, on ceasing to be a member, is eligible for reappointment.

subsection.leadIn: Any member appointed under section 3(1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) may at any time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: resign from his office by notice in writing to the Chief Executive; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be removed from office by the Chief Executive for permanent incapacity or other sufficient cause,

subsection.continued: and upon such resignation or removal the term for which he was appointed is deemed to have expired.

subsection.content: Where any member appointed under section 3(1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) is precluded by temporary incapacity or other cause from performing his functions as a member for any period, the Chief Executive may appoint another person to act in place of that member during that period.

Where any question arises under subsection (2)(b) or (3) as to whether any incapacity or cause exists or whether any incapacity is temporary or permanent or any cause is sufficient, the decision of the Chief Executive shall be final.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Chief Executive may declare office of member of Board to be vacant
section.leadIn: If the Chief Executive is satisfied that a member of the Board appointed under section 3(1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e)— (Amended 16 of 2003 s. 20)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has failed to attend 3 consecutive meetings of the Board without the permission of the Board; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt or made an arrangement with his creditors; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is incapacitated by physical or mental illness; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to discharge the functions of a member,

section.continued: the Chief Executive may declare his office as a member of the Board to be vacant, and shall notify that fact in such manner as the Chief Executive thinks fit and upon such declaration the office shall become vacant.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Quorum
section.content: The quorum of the Board is 5 and, while a member is disqualified from taking part in a decision or deliberation of the Board in respect of a matter, he is disregarded for the purposes of constituting a quorum of the Board for deciding, or deliberating on, that matter.

subsection.content: Subject to the foregoing provisions of this Schedule and to subsections (2) to (5), the Board has power to regulate its own procedure including the manner in which decisions of the Board may be made by a quorum of its members otherwise than at a meeting of the Board.
Meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places as the chairman of the Board may appoint.
The chairman appointed under section 3(1)(a) shall preside at any meeting of the Board.
If the chairman appointed under section 3(1)(a) is absent from any meeting of the Board, the members present at the meeting shall elect one of their number to act as chairman in his place.

The chairman appointed under section 3(1)(a) or the member acting in his place has a deliberative vote on all matters coming before the Board and in the case of an equality of votes he also has a casting vote.
The Board may, with the prior approval of the Secretary, fix a period of 12 months to be the financial year of the Board.

The Board shall, in each financial year, before a date to be appointed by the Secretary, submit to the Secretary a programme of its proposed activities and estimates of its income and expenditure for the next financial year.

The Secretary may approve or reject the programme and estimates submitted to him under subsection (2) and, in the case of a rejection, may require the Board to resubmit, within such time as he may direct, the programme or estimates, or both, modified in such manner as he may direct.
The Board shall comply with any requirement under subsection (3).
Subject to subsection (6), the Board may from time to time vary the estimates submitted under subsection (2), even after their approval by the Secretary.

Where the variation referred to in subsection (5) is an upward adjustment, the Board shall obtain the Secretary’s prior approval for the variation and where it is a downward adjustment the Board shall inform the Secretary in writing of the details of the variation.
The Board shall open and maintain an account with a bank within the meaning of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155).
The Board shall pay all moneys received by it into the account referred to in subsection (1).
The Board may write off the whole or any part of any debt due to the Board which it reasonably considers irrecoverable.
Any write off under subsection (1) takes effect for accounting purposes alone and does not extinguish any right of the Board to recover the debt which has been written off.
The Board shall maintain proper accounts and records of all income and expenditure.

After the end of each financial year, the Board shall cause to be prepared statements of income and expenditure during the previous financial year and of the assets and liabilities of the Board on the last day thereof and shall provide the statements to the auditor appointed under section 12 within 4 months after the end of the financial year.
The Board shall appoint an auditor, who has the right of access to all books of account, documents, vouchers and other records of the Board.

The auditor may also require from any person holding or accountable for any such books, documents, vouchers and records such information and explanations that he considers necessary in the performance of his functions.
The auditor shall audit the statements prepared under section 11(2) and shall report thereon to the Board within 3 months of the receipt of the statements from the Board.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Board may transact business by circulation of papers
section.content: The Board may transact any of its business by circulation of papers amongst members whether any such member is in or outside Hong Kong, and a resolution in writing which is approved in writing by a majority of the members is as valid and effectual as if it had been passed at a meeting of the Board.

subsection.content: The Board may establish, and appoint the members of, such committees for the better carrying out of the powers and functions of the Board as it thinks fit.
Persons who are not members of the Board are eligible for appointment to committees.
The Board shall appoint the chairman of a committee established under subsection (1) and the number of members of a committee is determined by the Board.
A committee may regulate its own procedure.

The proceedings of any committee established under subsection (1) is not invalidated by any defect in the appointment of any member thereof, the absence of any member from the meeting at which any such proceeding occurred or any vacancy amongst such members.
Subject to subsection (2) the Board may delegate in writing any of its powers or duties to any of its employees or any committee established under section 14(1).

subsection.leadIn: The Board shall not delegate the power or duty—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to establish any committee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to determine matters relating to the remuneration and terms and conditions of appointment or employment of the employees of the Board;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to establish, manage and control, or enter into an arrangement for the establishment, management and control of, any fund or scheme for the purpose of providing for the payment of allowances, benefits, gratuities, pensions and remuneration to the employees of the Board; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to furnish after the expiry of a financial year, a report on the activities and affairs of the Board for that year, a copy of its statements of accounts therefor and the auditor’s report on the accounts.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the terms of any delegation by the Board or to any directions of the Board, an employee or a committee delegated with a power or a duty under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may exercise and perform the delegated powers and duties with the same effect as if it were the Board itself; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is presumed to be acting in accordance with the terms of the delegation in the absence of proof to the contrary.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Documents of Board
section.content: Every document purporting to be an instrument made or issued by or on behalf of the Board and to be duly executed under the seal of the Board or to be signed or executed by a person authorized by the Board to act in that behalf, can be received in evidence and are deemed, without further proof, to be so made or issued unless the contrary is shown.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Technical and professional advisers
section.content: The Board may engage the services of technical and professional advisers as it thinks fit, and may determine all matters relating to their remuneration and terms and conditions of engagement.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Employees
section.content: The Board may appoint such employees as it thinks fit and determine all matters relating to their remuneration and terms and conditions of appointment or employment.

subsection.leadIn: The Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grant, or make provision for the grant of, pensions, gratuities and retirement benefits, to or in respect of its employees;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide other benefits for and in respect of its employees; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make payments, whether ex gratia or legally due, to the personal representative of a deceased employee or to any person who was dependent on such employee at his death.

subsection.leadIn: The Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: establish, manage and control any fund or scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter into an arrangement with any company or association for the establishment, management and control by such company or association either alone or jointly with the Board of any fund or scheme,

subsection.continued: for the purpose of providing for the pensions, gratuities, benefits and payments referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.content: The Board may make contribution to any fund or scheme referred to in subsection (2) and may require its employees to make contributions thereto.

subsection.def: In this section employees (僱員) includes any class of employee which the Board may specify and in subsection (1) includes former employees.

schedule.name: sch2

subsection.leadIn: The Medical Committee consists of the following 5 members—

subsection.leadIn: A member may at any time—

paragraph.name: a

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be removed from office by the Secretary for permanent incapacity or other sufficient cause.

subsection.content: Where a member referred to in subsection (1) is precluded by temporary incapacity or other cause from performing his functions as such member for any period, the Secretary may appoint another person to act in place of that member during that period.

Where any question arises under subsection (3) or (4) as to whether any incapacity or cause exists or whether any incapacity is temporary or permanent or any cause is sufficient, the decision of the Secretary is final.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Procedure of Medical Committee
section.content: The Medical Committee may determine its own procedure at its meetings and for conducting other business.
