section.leadIn: The amount of compensation payable to a claimant is a lump sum which is obtained by multiplying the percentage of permanent incapacity or additional permanent incapacity of the claimant determined under section 20 of this Ordinance by either of the following 2 sums, whichever is the less— (Amended 6 of 2010 s. 25)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a sum calculated by multiplying the monthly earnings of the claimant by the appropriate factor in column 2 of Table 1 according to the age of the claimant at the relevant date of application as specified in column 1 of that Table—
Table 1

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appropriate sum specified in column 2 of Table 2 according to the age of the claimant at the relevant date of application as specified in column 1 of that Table—
Table 2

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: For the purpose of this Schedule, earnings include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any remuneration or profit derived from an employment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any privilege or benefit the value of which is capable of being estimated in money;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: any overtime payments or other special remuneration for work done, whether by way of bonus, allowance or otherwise, if of constant character or for work habitually performed; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: tips if the employment be of such a nature that the habitual giving or receiving thereof is open and well known and is recognized by the employer,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: remuneration for intermittent overtime;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: casual payments of a non-recurrent nature;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the value of a travelling allowance or a travelling concession;

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: a contribution paid by the employer of a claimant towards any pension or provident fund; or

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: a sum paid to a claimant to cover any special expenses entailed on him by the nature of his employment.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: For the purpose of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a claimant can provide documentary evidence to the satisfaction of the Board concerning the earnings received by him as remuneration from his employer or employers in respect of his employment for 12 months in aggregate immediately preceding the relevant date of application in noisy occupations in Hong Kong, the monthly earnings of the claimant are the average monthly earnings for those 12 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a claimant cannot provide the documentary evidence as required by paragraph (a) and he is entitled to compensation by virtue of his fulfilling the condition in section 14(2)(b)(i) of this Ordinance but not section 14(2)(b)(ii) of this Ordinance or he is entitled to compensation by virtue of section 48(1) of this Ordinance, the monthly earnings of the claimant are, subject to paragraph (ba), the median monthly employment earnings of the total employed population of Hong Kong published by the Census and Statistics Department for the quarter immediately before the commencement# of Part V of this Ordinance; (Amended 5 of 1998 s. 20)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: if a claimant referred to in paragraph (b) has been employed at any time beginning on the commencement# of Part V of this Ordinance under a continuous contract in any noisy occupation in Hong Kong, the monthly earnings of the claimant are the median monthly employment earnings of the total employed population of Hong Kong published by the Census and Statistics Department for the quarter immediately before the commencement of sections 1 to 20 of the amending Ordinance, that is to say, 6 March 1998; (Added 5 of 1998 s. 20. Amended 6 of 2010 s. 25)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case, the monthly earnings of a claimant are the median monthly employment earnings of the total employed population of Hong Kong published by the Census and Statistics Department for the quarter immediately before the relevant date of application.

section.name: s3A
section.content: Section 3(ba) shall only apply to an application for compensation made on or after the commencement of sections 1 to 20 of the amending Ordinance, that is to say, 6 March 1998.

section.name: s3B
section.leadIn: For the purposes of computing a claimant’s employment for 12 months in aggregate under section 3(a), the claimant’s absence from work by reason of—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: the claimant’s injury or his suffering from an occupational disease in respect of which compensation is payable in accordance with the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282); (Amended 16 of 2003 s. 24)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the claimant’s having obtained his employer’s consent to the absence subject to a condition that no earnings are accrued for the claimant during such absence, (Added 16 of 2003 s. 24)

section.continued: shall not be counted towards the 12-month period in aggregate if the period or periods of absence from work amount to 30 consecutive days or more.

section.name: s4
section.def: In this Schedule, subject to section 5, relevant date of application (提出申請的有關日期) means the date of an application for compensation under section 15 of this Ordinance by a claimant and pursuant to that application compensation is payable or was paid to the claimant.

paragraph.name: b

def.name: RelevantDateOfApplication

paragraph.name: a
